entry.title: Lock screen disable bug
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set BIP to disable lock screen when charging 2. Connect charger 3. Remove charger 4. Turn phone off then on What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? Lock screen stays disabled until i manually re-enable it What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? BIP Pro 5.0.4 Which device are you using? HTC Wildfire S Which carrier are you using? Vodafone What language is your device set to? English (UK) Which version of Android are you using? Android 2.3.3 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Advanced task killer Please provide any additional information here:

entry.title: Does not work properly on Samsung Galaxy Y CDMA
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Charge the battery till 100 % (off mode) 2. When you turn on the mobile, the indicator directly drop to 98% or 96% 3. The voltage of the battery always shown as 0.003V ps1: the mobile is brand new, bought from authorized Samsung Reseller. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? 2: Should have shown 100% 3: Should have shown between 3.7 to 4.0 volt What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Free, 4.0.7 Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy Y CDMA (Samsung SCH-i509) Which carrier are you using? Telkom Flexi What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Nope Please provide any additional information here: It works perfectly fine on my other Samsung Device (Galaxy S2, GT-I9100) but not the SCH-i509. Great aps though, hopefully there's fix soon
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Lock Screen Bug under Android 4 with Galaxy Nexus
entry.content:
Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Android 4 (Galaxy Nexus) 2. Running the app 3. Disable the Lock Screen Funktion in the options
The screen will unlock sporadically. Well not always but often.
Version: Battery Indicator Pro
Device: Galaxa Nexus with Android 4.0.1
Carrier: Vodafone
Language: German
No "Task Killer" installed!

entry.title: Cannot use menu options after latest update
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. 2. 3. [Add or remove numbers as necessary] What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? All menu options should work, but only "Close" functions without any issues. Selecting "Settings" causes a force close, and selecting "Logs" or "Help" opens a new window that constantly causes force closes until I hit home to dismiss the screen, so there is no way I can use these options. Also, when the program window first appears, it is grayed out with the rest of the screen. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro v5.0.5 Which device are you using? Samsung Behold II Which carrier are you using? T-Mobile What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 1.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Excessive battery drain using widget on ICS
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run a leaked version of ICS with Sense What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? While I realise it is unfair to expect you to support leaked versions of Google Os's, I wanted to report this to highlight a future possible issue when officially Release, when using this widget on ICS my battery drains from full charge to 0 in under 6 hours. Now removed the widget and today over 13 hours and still 65% left. This was on a clean install. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Free Which device are you using? HTC Sensation Which carrier are you using? Vodafone UK What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? ICS leak with Sense Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Pressing the button Disable Lock Screen, and the button changes to Reenable Lock Screen - however the screen is always locked whenever I switch on the phone. 2. Same thing when charging the phone, the screen is always locked when switched on. 3. This used to work - all the necessary options under in the menu have been set. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? The screen is alway locked when the phone is switched on What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? entry.title: Icon jumps position
entry.content:
I have 3 icons in the top left: battery-indicator, juice-defender and 3g watchdog.
When battery-indicator is running then the position of battery-indicator icon shifts amongst the other icons about every 30 seconds. I'd expect it to stay in the same place. When the battery-indicator icon is disabled the other icons remain in the same place.
This is very distracting when reading a book.
I'm using the free branch, version 4.1.1 Im using a samsung galaxy s2 Carrier is Telecom XT (New Zealand) Language is English Android Version 2.3.3 AutoKiller memory is installed.

entry.title: Extreme Percentage jump on Samsung Galaxy S2
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Restarting the phone 2. Charging the phone 3. [Add or remove numbers as necessary] What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? Today I was using my phone, showing 57% battery left, than my friend told me on the phone sorry I cannot hear you, so I restarted it. Came back 29% battery available after the restart. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy S2 - I9100XXLPR Which carrier are you using? O2 carrier in UK What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? Android version 4.0.3 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Yes, but it's not allowed to kill Battery Indicator Pro Please provide any additional information here: Once happened when I was charging my phone the Battery Indicator Pro showed 97% charge, when the original battery checker told me it's 100% full. Couple of times happened after restarting the phone the battery level extremely dropped down after restart. I didn't bothered to report it down, because I'm not sure this is a phone failure or software failure. Phone was once sent away for repair, because the network connection wasn't available to the carrier. These days I'm having similar issues with it, and I requested Samsung to respond to my issues.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Causing "Android OS" to use considerably more battery
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Noticed android OS was using more battery than my screen. 2.Factory reset. 3. Installed all suspect apps 1 at a time 2h between watching for Android OS to spike. 4. After having this app installed for 2h noticed Android OS had passed all but WiFi and screen. 5. Charged to 100% to reset usage. 2h after unplugging Android OS was the #1 battery user. 6. Uninstalled and repeated step 5, Screen was #1, Android OS was #6. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? FREE Which device are you using? Droid RAZR Which carrier are you using? Verizon What language is your device set to? English (US) Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:

entry.title: Menu settings switched in Alarms menu
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Menu 2. Settings 3. Alarm 4. Add alarm 5. Alarmtype 6. Charge drops below What is the expected outcome? Alarm sounds when battery level drops below preset value What happens instead? Alarm sounds when battery level rises above set level when charging What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro v. 5.1.5. Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy S Plus Which carrier are you using? Vodafone What language is your device set to? Dutch Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Yes, but set to manual, never automatic Please provide any additional information here: Selecting 'charge drops below' results in an alarm set for 'rises above', this selection is also shown as set in the menu

entry.content:
Battery Indicator show an icon with percentage in the upper left notification area. This is ok. When I pull down for detailed information I get this : "Losgekoppeld For 489 Hours". So after some time a part of the Dutch translation switches to English.
